quiz.name: Module 1: Derivative Instrument and Derivative Market Features
quiz.subtopic: Module 1: Derivative Instrument and Derivative Market Features

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-2020-C2-Deriv-Kennan-03
entry.itemBody: Compared to over-the-counter (OTC) derivatives that are not cleared, the credit risk of exchange-traded derivatives is most likely:

answerFeedback.39206ac0-72d1-4993-9ce3-1ca400a1711b: Incorrect because derivative exchanges require collateral on deposit upon inception and during the life of a trade in order to minimize counterparty credit risk. This deposit is paid by each counterparty via a financial intermediary to the exchange, which then provides a guarantee against counterparty default, whereas OTC (over-the-counter) instruments have less transparency, usually involve more counterparty risk. Therefore, compared to OTC derivatives that are not cleared, the credit risk of exchange-traded derivatives is lower, not higher.
answerFeedback.410fcfc5-fa12-442d-9f78-2c1911b6dd01: Correct because derivative exchanges require collateral on deposit upon inception and during the life of a trade in order to minimize counterparty credit risk. This deposit is paid by each counterparty via a financial intermediary to the exchange, which then provides a guarantee against counterparty default, whereas OTC (over-the-counter) instruments have less transparency, usually involve more counterparty risk. Therefore, compared to OTC derivatives that are not cleared, the credit risk of exchange-traded derivatives is lower.
answerFeedback.88864cfe-5c82-45f2-b94b-764592c06e6c: Incorrect because derivative exchanges require collateral on deposit upon inception and during the life of a trade in order to minimize counterparty credit risk. This deposit is paid by each counterparty via a financial intermediary to the exchange, which then provides a guarantee against counterparty default, whereas OTC (over-the-counter) instruments have less transparency, usually involve more counterparty risk. Therefore, compared to OTC derivatives that are not cleared, the credit risk of exchange-traded derivatives is lower, not the same.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.03-Deriv-Bangaruswamy-01
entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements is most accurate?

answerFeedback.58fd9cc2-eda7-4c00-a1f9-b365768b1907: Correct because other derivative underlyings include weather, cryptocurrencies, and longevity, all of which can influence the financial performance of various market participants. Therefore, longevity is an example of an underlying of a derivative.
answerFeedback.bab2c1ec-6fe8-49d4-a164-8739137f0cda: Incorrect because a distinct derivative contract, such as a derivative on a stock or bond, is an example of a stand-alone derivative. An embedded derivative is a derivative within an underlying, such as a callable, puttable, or convertible bond. Therefore, convertible bond is not a stand-alone derivative, but an embedded derivative.
answerFeedback.f019421e-05b8-4e29-88ef-49e5c3a1e885: Incorrect because a derivative does not directly pass through the returns of the underlying but transforms the performance of the underlying.

choices.itemBody: A. Longevity is an example of an underlying of a derivative
B. A convertible bond is an example of a stand-alone derivative
C. Derivatives directly pass through the returns of the underlying

entry.title: ITEM_2019BDeriv01EWL10U1
entry.itemBody: Derivatives derive their performance from:

answerFeedback.0efe7193-de5c-40ca-9c26-61d936d0d67d: Incorrect because derivatives are subject to the risk of default. Forward contracts are subject to default. This also applies to swaps, where either party can default but only one party can default at a particular time. While a credit derivative provides protection… against a specific credit loss, it does not eliminate the risk of default.
answerFeedback.186c1f60-4145-4467-85c9-b2062f8ce840: Correct because the most common definition of a derivative is a financial instrument that derives its performance from the performance of the underlying asset.
answerFeedback.82f0c590-2be9-4ecc-95f7-ed8074be51ec: Incorrect because the transformation of performance for the case of derivatives is a critical, factor distinguishing derivatives from mutual funds and exchange-traded funds and some other straight pass-through instruments.

choices.itemBody: A. the performance of the underlying asset.
B. eliminating the risk of counterparty default.
C. the straight pass-through performance of the underlying.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-L1-05207
entry.itemBody: Compared to over-the-counter (OTC) derivative markets, exchange-traded derivative markets most likely have greater:

answerFeedback.2e3f2db3-cb25-42ad-99de-b87506a6bd57: Incorrect because exchange-traded derivatives are standardized, whereas OTC derivatives are customized. Therefore, exchange-traded derivatives markets have lower customization than OTC derivatives markets.
answerFeedback.618a0304-cc0a-4cef-a2e5-ff8e98fb8ecd: Incorrect because the OTC markets for derivatives will remain considerably more flexible than the exchange-listed markets. Therefore, exchange-traded derivatives markets have lower level of flexibility than OTC derivatives markets.
answerFeedback.e4b3e4a2-9e98-4253-8cb8-71cc9321f4de: Correct because many transactions in OTC markets will retain a degree of privacy with lower transparency. In contrast, exchange markets are said to have transparency, which means that full information on all transactions is disclosed to exchanges and regulatory bodies. Therefore, exchange-traded derivatives markets have greater transparency than OTC derivatives markets.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.03-Deriv-Berlinicke-06
entry.itemBody: Which of the following derivative underlyings is an example of a soft commodity?

answerFeedback.0a048ee5-6cb1-4170-9602-d44005a04b6d: Correct because soft commodities are agricultural products, such as cattle and corn, and hard commodities are natural resources, such as crude oil and metals. Also, crude oil, soybeans, copper, and gold are all commodities. Commodities are considered either 'hard' (those mined, such as copper, or extracted, such as oil) or 'soft' (those grown over a period of time, such as livestock, grains, and cash crops, such as coffee).
answerFeedback.66c7cbb0-bf9b-49c8-b608-4a363aa3fc5d: Incorrect because, despite its physical (liquid) nature, crude oil is categorized as a hard commodity since it is a natural resource. Soft commodities are agricultural products, such as cattle and corn, and hard commodities are natural resources, such as crude oil and metals.
answerFeedback.de321bee-dc19-4be1-a03b-4ad353dca507: Incorrect because gold is a metal and hence a hard commodity. Soft commodities are agricultural products, such as cattle and corn, and hard commodities are natural resources, such as crude oil and metals. Also, crude oil, soybeans, copper, and gold are all commodities. Commodities are considered either 'hard' (those mined, such as copper, or extracted, such as oil) or 'soft' (those grown over a period of time, such as livestock, grains, and cash crops, such as coffee).

entry.body:
Montau AG is a German capital goods producer that manufactures its products domestically and delivers its products to clients globally. Montau’s global sales manager shares the following draft commercial contract with his Treasury team:

Montau AG Commercial Export Contract

Contract Date: [Today]
Goods Seller: Montau AG, Frankfurt, Germany
Goods Buyer: Jeon Inc., Seoul, Korea
Description of Goods: A-Series Laser Cutting Machine
Quantity: One
Delivery Terms: Freight on Board (FOB), Busan Korea with all shipping, tax and delivery costs payable by Goods Buyer
Delivery Date: [75 Days from Contract Date]
Payment Terms: 100% of Contract Price payable by Goods Buyer to Good Seller on Delivery Date
Contract Price: KRW650,000,000

Montau AG’s Treasury manager is tasked with addressing the financial risk of this prospective transaction.
entry.title: Vignette
CFA2374-s004-Q6

feedback.neutral: B is correct. A 75-day timing difference exists between the commercial contract date and the delivery date when Montau AG is paid for the machine in KRW. A is true but does not explain why the use of a derivative is preferable to a spot market transaction. If as in C Montau were to sell the KRW it receives and buy EUR in a spot market transaction on the delivery date, it would be exposed to unfavorable changes in the KRW/EUR exchange rate over the 75-day period. A derivative contract in which the underlying KRW/EUR forward rate is agreed today and exchanged on the delivery date allows Montau to hedge or offset the EUR value of the future KRW payment. The derivative is therefore a more suitable contract to address the financial risk of the commercial transaction than a spot market sale of KRW.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements best describes why Montau AG should consider a derivative rather than a spot market transaction to manage the financial risk of this commercial contract?

choices.itemBody: A. Montau AG is selling a machine at a contract price in KRW and incurs costs based in EUR.
B. Montau AG faces a 75-day timing difference between the commercial contract date and the delivery date when Montau AG is paid for the machine in KRW.
C. Montau AG is unable to sell KRW today in order to offset the contract price of machinery delivered to Jeon Inc.

entry.title: CFA2374-s004-Q7

feedback.neutral: A is correct. The derivative best suited to hedge Montau’s financial risk is a firm commitment derivative in which a pre-determined amount is exchanged at settlement. The derivative underlying should be currencies, specifically the sale of KRW at a fixed EUR price in the future to offset or hedge the financial risk of the commercial contract. The machine price referenced under B is not considered an underlying, and C hedges the opposite of Montau’s underlying exposure.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following types of derivative and underlyings are best suited to hedge Montau’s financial risk under the commercial transaction?

choices.itemBody: A. Montau AG should consider a firm commitment derivative with currency as an underlying, specifically the sale of KRW at a fixed EUR price.
B. Montau AG should consider a contingent claim derivative with the price of the machine as its underlying, specifically an A-series laser cutting machine.
C. Montau AG should consider a contingent claim derivative with currency as an underlying, specifically the sale of EUR at a fixed KRW price.

entry.title: CFA2374-s004-Q8

feedback.neutral: C is correct as per the following diagram:

entry.itemBody: Identify A, B, and C in the correct order in the following diagram, as in Exhibit 1, for the derivative to hedge Montau's financial risk under the commercial transaction.

choices.itemBody: A. A: Financial intermediary, B: KRW650,000,000, C: Fixed EUR amount
B. A: Jeon Inc., B: KRW650,000,000, C: Fixed EUR amount
C. A: Financial intermediary, B: Fixed EUR amount, C: KRW650,000,000.

entry.title: CFA2374-s004-Q9

feedback.neutral: A is correct. The OTC market is most appropriate for Montau, as OTC contracts may be customized to match Montau’s desired risk exposure profile. This is important to end users seeking to hedge a specific underlying exposure based upon non-standard terms. Montau would be unlikely to find an ETD contract under B that matches the exact size and maturity date of its desired hedge, which also makes C incorrect.

entry.itemBody: Which of the following statements about the most appropriate derivative market to hedge Montau AG’s financial risk under the commercial contract is most accurate?

choices.itemBody: A. The OTC market is most appropriate for Montau, as it is able to customize the contract to match its desired risk exposure profile.
B. The ETD market is most appropriate for Montau, as it offers a standardized and transparent contract to match its desired risk exposure profile.
C. Both the ETD and OTC markets are appropriate for Montau AG to hedge its financial risk under the transaction, so it should choose the market with the best price.

entry.title: CFA2374-s004-Q10

feedback.neutral: B is correct. In a centrally cleared OTC derivative contract, the central counterparty becomes the counterparty in all contracts and assumes the credit risk associated with individual derivative contracts. A is likely incorrect because the CCP takes actions to ensure that it can fulfill its obligations to its counterparties. C is incorrect because the CCP inserts itself between parties with opposite positions.

entry.itemBody: If Montau enters into a centrally cleared derivative contract on the OTC market, which of the following statements about credit risk associated with the derivative is most likely correct?

choices.itemBody: A. Montau faces credit risk associated with the possibility that its counterparty to the contract may not fulfill its contractual obligation.
B. Montau poses a credit risk to its counterparty because it may fail to fulfill its contractual obligation.
C. Montau poses a credit risk to a derivative contract end user holding a contract with the opposite features of Montau’s.

entry.title: ITEM_20170601014
entry.itemBody: A derivative can best be described as a financial instrument that:

answerFeedback.9816586a-7315-4e32-9230-60a3b14d7a3d: Incorrect. A derivative transforms the performance of the underlying asset rather than passing through the returns of the underlying asset.
answerFeedback.db15928f-b844-481a-8200-a2e49a5281d7: Incorrect. A derivative transforms the performance of the underlying asset rather than duplicating the performance of the underlying asset.
answerFeedback.e8ea618a-ce5e-4677-bb02-090f2375b816: Correct. The best characterization of a derivative is that it typically transforms the underlying asset’s performance.

choices.itemBody: C. passes through the underlying asset’s returns.

entry.title: ITEM_20170601016
entry.itemBody: Which of the following derivatives is least likely to be classified as a contingent claim?

answerFeedback.6b7ab2a4-b936-4a4a-bc6f-92c53848bf6d: Correct. A futures contract is classified as a forward commitment in which the buyer undertakes to purchase the underlying asset from the seller at a later date and at a price agreed on by the two parties when the contract is initiated.
answerFeedback.bddf1ccb-99f8-4115-ae1e-be999ad5ea54: Incorrect. A credit default swap is a contingent claim in which the credit protection seller provides protection to the credit protection buyer against the credit risk of a third party.
answerFeedback.da81bd23-171b-46cc-a3e6-a2d06736af59: Incorrect. A call option contract is a contingent claim in which the buyer of the option has a right to purchase the underlying asset at a fixed price on or before a pre-specified expiration date.

entry.title: ITEM_20170601020
entry.itemBody: In contrast to over-the-counter options, futures contracts most likely:

answerFeedback.0da0cb78-bbaa-4519-9a8b-0950d5841666: Correct. Over-the-counter options are exposed to default risk, but futures contracts are standardized transactions that take place on futures exchanges and are not exposed to default risk.
answerFeedback.883065a6-a77e-4c1c-9cd9-494b9f73f841: Incorrect. Futures contracts are commitments, but options represent a right.
answerFeedback.d7072120-102b-4be9-a890-e83df41be91d: Incorrect. Futures contracts are not private; they are standardized instruments that trade on organized exchanges.

choices.itemBody: A. are not exposed to default risk.
C. represent a right rather than a commitment.

entry.title: ITEM_20170601037
entry.itemBody: Which of these is best classified as a forward commitment?

answerFeedback.3398561d-f3fd-42db-8249-315e790a6610: Incorrect. A call option is an example of a contingent claim.
answerFeedback.6ff11456-74e3-4963-886a-22f3e114eb3f: Correct. A swap agreement is equivalent to a series of forward agreements, which can be described as forward commitments.
answerFeedback.fa26943a-396f-470f-8dea-46a5dba48d5b: Incorrect. A convertible bond does not meet the definition of a forward commitment.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.03-Deriv-Glover-01
entry.itemBody: Which of the following derivative contracts is best described as a contingent claim?

answerFeedback.bb5d512a-4911-4588-87f8-3363a3cd737e: Correct because another type of derivative is a contingent claim, in which one of the counterparties determines whether and when the trade will settle. An option is the primary contingent claim.
answerFeedback.bd5f35ac-397b-4244-952b-8dbaa3a0e0cd: Incorrect because derivative contracts can be classified as either firm commitments or contingent claims. Firm commitments include forward contracts, futures contracts, and swaps involving a periodic exchange of cash flows and an option is the primary contingent claim.
answerFeedback.e09a5552-9b29-43cc-949a-6f4ce120a1a5: Incorrect because derivative contracts can be classified as either firm commitments or contingent claims. Firm commitments include forward contracts, futures contracts, and swaps involving a periodic exchange of cash flows and an option is the primary contingent claim.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.03-Deriv-Lee-02
entry.itemBody: Compared to over-the-counter derivatives, exchange-traded derivatives:

answerFeedback.621d2a80-ffdc-4eb8-a647-5e1c873e2b1e: Incorrect because OTC and ETD markets differ in several ways, including that ETD contracts are more standardized.
answerFeedback.6baa289a-aad9-440c-ab9b-63b008364810: Correct because OTC and ETD markets differ in several ways, including that ETD contracts have lower trading and transaction costs.
answerFeedback.f82e55ef-fb88-4d55-9a0e-3d816f32acea: Incorrect because OTC and ETD markets differ in several ways, including that OTC instruments have less transparency, whereas ETD markets have transparency.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.03-Deriv-Kashyap-05
entry.itemBody: Which of the following most likely has an embedded derivative in its structure?

answerFeedback.07d099c8-ee79-4a53-a2df-6e6930917074: Incorrect because a stand-alone derivative, is a distinct derivative contract, such as a derivative on a stock or bond. A put option is therefore a stand-alone derivative not an embedded derivative.
answerFeedback.4275a65c-8bd9-4840-a60e-0ab0326fb0e9: Correct because an embedded derivative is a derivative within an underlying, such as a callable, puttable, or convertible bond.
answerFeedback.bb9f63ce-f7de-4aec-b5d6-1e5bf0972738: Incorrect because a stand-alone derivative, is a distinct derivative contract, such as a derivative on a stock or bond. A futures contract is also a distinct derivative contract as it is not embedded in the underlying asset.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.03-Deriv-Kashyap-07
entry.itemBody: In the over-the-counter derivatives market, most transactions occur between end users and:

answerFeedback.4d78f3a2-0587-4f59-8657-1d755bc66b5e: Incorrect because end users do not generally trade with other end users. OTC derivative markets involve contracts entered between derivatives end users and dealers, or financial intermediaries, such as commercial banks or investment banks.
answerFeedback.ba21540b-658f-4692-9eeb-8e4b2aca9738: Incorrect because the central counterparty provides clearing and settlement functions rather than trading derivatives. A central counterparty (CCP) assumes the credit risk between derivative counterparties, one of which is typically a financial intermediary. CCPs provide clearing and settlement for most derivative contracts.
answerFeedback.bdb3fd25-2c4e-4394-88c5-dea5d513a20d: Correct because OTC (over-the-counter) derivative markets involve contracts entered between derivatives end users and dealers, or financial intermediaries, such as commercial banks or investment banks.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.03-Deriv-Kashyap-11
entry.itemBody: An end user seeking to hedge a specific underlying exposure having non-standard size and settlement dates would most likely trade on a(n):

answerFeedback.4dd1ab74-5380-4232-bf48-7e48b18b062c: Incorrect because ETD (exchange-traded derivative) contracts are more formal and standardized, which facilitates a more liquid and transparent market. Terms and conditions—such as the size of each contract, type, quality, and location of underlying for commodities and maturity date—are set by the exchange.
answerFeedback.54b050d2-5eb8-4857-8e78-afadf0ad7b4c: Incorrect because futures contracts are forward contracts with standardized sizes, dates, and underlyings that trade on futures exchanges. Therefore, they are inappropriate for the non-standard size and settlement dates required by the end user.
answerFeedback.567388e4-1375-40df-8191-3edef7c4f5cc: Correct because the terms of OTC (over-the-counter) contracts can be customized to match a desired risk exposure profile. This flexibility is important to end users seeking to hedge a specific existing or anticipated underlying exposure based upon non-standard terms.

entry.title: ITEM_CFA-MC-2022.08-Deriv-Tyler-10
entry.itemBody:
The following portfolios contain a company's stock and a derivative on the stock:

Portfolio Securities
1 Stock and a short futures position
2 Stock and a short call option position
3 Stock and a short warrant position

The portfolio containing a derivative acting as a firm commitment to hedge the stock is most likely:

answerFeedback.00b9e2f3-8f41-4b17-90ae-7acef0e4f7a3: Correct because the buyer of a derivative enters a contract whose value changes in a way similar to a long position in the underlying. Thus a short futures position hedges the exposure to the underlying: Use of a derivative to offset or neutralize existing or anticipated exposure to an underlying is referred to as hedging, with the derivative itself commonly described as a hedge of the underlying transaction. In addition, a futures position is a firm commitment: Firm commitments include forward contracts, futures contracts, and swaps involving a periodic exchange of cash flows.
answerFeedback.72872603-8a7c-433a-b0af-6b9c85cac533: Incorrect because a warrant is a type of option and an option is an example of a contingent claim rather than a firm commitment. Firm commitments include forward contracts, futures contracts, and swaps involving a periodic exchange of cash flows. Another type of derivative is a contingent claim, in which one of the counterparties determines whether and when the trade will settle. An option is the primary contingent claim. Companies may also issue warrants, which are options granted to employees or sold to the public that allow holders to purchase shares at a fixed price in the future directly from the issuer.
answerFeedback.bfc76074-75ce-4c52-8af1-b77f7cd7d765: Incorrect because an option is an example of a contingent claim rather than a firm commitment. Firm commitments include forward contracts, futures contracts, and swaps involving a periodic exchange of cash flows. Another type of derivative is a contingent claim, in which one of the counterparties determines whether and when the trade will settle. An option is the primary contingent claim.
